DemoDays

Student demos at the intersection of art, design and code.

October 2012

Archival Content • Submit correction

The October 2012 DemoDays was held on 10/06/2012 at Pivotal Labs in New York City.

Join us next time!

DemoDays is a monthly student-run event in NYC, organized by tech@NYU, Parsons Code Club, Create@Cooper and Columbia ADI. We're all about fostering a community of students who create things. We want to provide a platform for student builders to present their work, to celebrate their creations, and let that inspire other students to build projects they care about.

Speaker

Steve Ritter

I had a nightmare one time where I needed to buy some concert tickets and I got caught in an infinite loop of loading screens and reCAPTCHA's and getting scammed on Craigslist. Well recently, I think New York's very own SeatGeek heard my cries and came down from the heavens with some of the coolest innovation in online tech since Twilio. It's like I'm running NASA's central control board of event ticketing.

DemoDays

tech@NYU in conjunction with create@cooper, NYU Poly EIA, and Major League Hacking.

Want to attend more events like this? Learn more about tech@NYU!
